headline: Google Bets Big on Nuclear Fusion With MIT Spinoff Commonwealth
summary: Google is making a big bet on a power source that hasn’t yet been used successfully anywhere in the world: nuclear fusion.  The tech company said on Monday that it will buy power from a planned nuclear fusion plant in Virginia developed by Commonwealth Fusion Systems, using technology based on research at M.I.T. Google will also increase an existing equity investment in Commonwealth, adding to the more than $2 billion the company has already raised.  “It’s a world-changing technology, in our view,” said Michael Terrell, Google’s senior director for clean energy and carbon reduction, on a call with journalists.

raw.headline: Google Bets Big on Nuclear Fusion With MIT Spinoff Commonwealth
raw.summary: Google is making a big bet on a power source that hasn’t yet been used successfully anywhere in the world: nuclear fusion. Google will also increase an existing equity investment in Commonwealth, adding to the more than $2 billion the company has already raised.  “It’s a world-changing technology, in our view,” said Michael Terrell, Google’s senior director for clean energy and carbon reduction, on a call with journalists.

headline: Tech Industry Cheers Canada's Withdrawal of Digital Tax
summary: The tech industry is rejoicing after Canada withdrew its digital-services tax, which would have cost the sector billions of dollars per year starting Monday. "We welcome the Canadian government’s decision to withdraw this ill-advised measure," said Megan Funkhouser, senior director of tax and trade policy at the Information Technology Industry Council.

headline: Chinese tech stocks soar in 2025 while US giants stall
summary: US tech giants may be treading water in 2025, but Chinese tech stocks are up nearly 20% this year. Morning Brief: Market Sunrise host Ramzan Karmali breaks down what’s behind the rally in China and whether investors should rethink their bet on the Magnificent Seven — the group of tech stocks comprised of Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA), Amazon, Meta Platforms (META), and Microsoft (MSFT). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief: Market Sunrise here.
